title: Awesome List Updates on Aug 13, 2023

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### (requires Neovim 0.5)

*   [roobert/action-hints.nvim (‚≠ê102)](https://github.com/roobert/action-hints.nvim) - Show information about the word under the cursor in the statusline or as virtual text.
*   [roobert/hoversplit.nvim (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/roobert/hoversplit.nvim) - Automatically updated documentation and information about code symbols in a split window.

### Web Development / Diagnostics

*   [roobert/tailwindcss-colorizer-cmp.nvim (‚≠ê363)](https://github.com/roobert/tailwindcss-colorizer-cmp.nvim) - Add vscode-style TailwindCSS completion to nvim-cmp.

### Syntax / Diagnostics

*   [roobert/surround-ui.nvim (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/roobert/surround-ui.nvim) - Helper or training aid for kylechui/nvim-surround.

### Search / Diagnostics

*   [roobert/search-replace.nvim (‚≠ê222)](https://github.com/roobert/search-replace.nvim) - Builds on the native search and replace experience.

### Tabline / Diagnostics

*   [roobert/bufferline-cycle-windowless.nvim (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/roobert/bufferline-cycle-windowless.nvim) - A bufferline extension to cycle through windowless buffers to give a more traditional tab based experience.

### Motion / Diagnostics

*   [roobert/tabtree.nvim (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/roobert/tabtree.nvim) - Jump between significant code elements, such as brackets, quotes, etc.
items.content_html:
(requires Neovim 0.5)

  • roobert/action-hints.nvim (‚≠ê102) - Show information about the word under the cursor in the statusline or as virtual text.
  • roobert/hoversplit.nvim (‚≠ê38) - Automatically updated documentation and information about code symbols in a split window.

Web Development / Diagnostics

  • roobert/tailwindcss-colorizer-cmp.nvim (‚≠ê363) - Add vscode-style TailwindCSS completion to nvim-cmp.

Syntax / Diagnostics

  • roobert/surround-ui.nvim (‚≠ê91) - Helper or training aid for kylechui/nvim-surround.

Search / Diagnostics

  • roobert/search-replace.nvim (‚≠ê222) - Builds on the native search and replace experience.

Tabline / Diagnostics

  • roobert/bufferline-cycle-windowless.nvim (‚≠ê37) - A bufferline extension to cycle through windowless buffers to give a more traditional tab based experience.

Motion / Diagnostics

  • roobert/tabtree.nvim (‚≠ê42) - Jump between significant code elements, such as brackets, quotes, etc.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Stanford / Commonsense Knowledgebase

*   [Noah Goodman](https://cocolab.stanford.edu/ndg.html) - ***Department of Psychology, Computer Science Department, Stanford***, [Computation & Cognition Lab (CoCoLab)](https://cocolab.stanford.edu/) - ***Stanford***.
*   [Michael Frank](https://web.stanford.edu/~mcfrank/) - ***Department of Psychology, Stanford***, [The Stanford Language and Cognition Lab](http://langcog.stanford.edu/) - ***Stanford***.
*   [Tobias Gerstenberg](https://cicl.stanford.edu/member/tobias_gerstenberg/) - ***Department of Psychology, Stanford***, [Causality in Cognition Lab (CICL)](https://cicl.stanford.edu/) - ***Stanford***.
*   [Chelsea Finn](http://ai.stanford.edu/~cbfinn/) - ***Computer Science Department, Stanford***, [Intelligence through Robotic Interaction at Scale (IRIS Group)](https://irislab.stanford.edu/) - ***Stanford***.
items.content_html:
Stanford / Commonsense Knowledgebase

  • Noah Goodman - Department of Psychology, Computer Science Department, Stanford, Computation & Cognition Lab (CoCoLab) - Stanford.
  • Michael Frank - Department of Psychology, Stanford, The Stanford Language and Cognition Lab - Stanford.
  • Tobias Gerstenberg - Department of Psychology, Stanford, Causality in Cognition Lab (CICL) - Stanford.
  • Chelsea Finn - Computer Science Department, Stanford, Intelligence through Robotic Interaction at Scale (IRIS Group) - Stanford.

items.title: Awesome Minecraft
items.content_text:
### Softwares / Launchers

*   [Prism](https://prismlauncher.org) - A fork of MultiMC, capable of downloading modpacks and other resources directly from CurseForge and FTB.
items.content_html:
Softwares / Launchers

  • Prism - A fork of MultiMC, capable of downloading modpacks and other resources directly from CurseForge and FTB.
